property.name: livy.environment
property.description: Specifies Livy's environment. May either be "production" or "development". In "development" mode, Livy will enable debugging options, such as reporting possible routes on a 404. defaults to development

property.name: livy.server.port
property.description: What port to start the server on. Defaults to 8999.

property.name: livy.server.session.timeout
property.description: Time in milliseconds on how long Livy will wait before timing out an idle session. Default is one hour.

property.name: livy.impersonation.enabled
property.description: If livy should use proxy users when submitting a job.

property.name: livy.impersonation.enabled
property.description: If livy should use proxy users when submitting a job.

property.name: livy.server.csrf_protection.enabled
property.description: Whether to enable csrf protection for livy's rest api.

property.name: livy.repl.enableHiveContext
property.description: Whether to enable HiveContext in livy interpreter

property.name: livy.server.recovery.mode
property.description: Recovery mode for livy, either be "off" or "recovery".

property.name: livy.server.recovery.state-store
property.description: Where Livy should store state for recovery.

property.name: livy.server.recovery.state-store.url
property.description: Where Livy should store state for recovery.
